info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN LOGAN AND SOUTHEASTERN HARDIN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Marseilles to near Belle Center, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Russells Point, Belle Center, Northwood, Mount Victory, Rushsylvania, Huntsville, Ridgeway, Grant, Silver Creek, Pfeiffer, Hepburn, Mentzer and Big Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
